data.title: Love the Ugly Oyster
data.text: This is our go to restaurant when we go to concerts/events in town. Great food and service. Good array of beers and drinks. Neighborhood pub atmosphere.

data.title: After a great golf day
data.text: Friends stopped with me on the way home from golf. I've been here many times, and always enjoy it. These friends were first timers. We should have made reservations but I overlooked it. They still got us a table and asked if we could finish in a little over an hour which was not a problem. Fast efficient service and really good Pub food. We all had soups and all were great. Fish n Chips were great as were the Crab Cake Sandwiches that my friends enjoyed. Outstanding selection of beer and we were in and out in  less than an hours. A very nice and cozy Pub. Thank you for your service!

data.title: Delicious food, Great Atmosphere, Wonderful Service!
data.text: So glad we found this gem in downtown Reading! We loved the raw oysters, the service was excellent, and the atmosphere has an old world feel that we enjoyed very much, Can't wait to go back!

data.title: We all got sick on the food!
data.text: I went as part of a mixed-aged group to celebrate a birthday. The place was crowded; the service was bad; food dribbled out over the course of a half hour; the food was so bad that most of us in the party got sick on it. The men's restroom should never have passed code. I wanted to look at the place but they highly frowned on walking around, as if they had something they didn't want me to see..  The place came recommended, but I will never go back.

data.title: Great find
data.text: Awesome oysters! All four in my party had different dishes (seafood, steak, veggie options) and all loved them. Get a reservation! We went hoping for a table and had to sit at the bar. Not the worst thing in the world but service is a bit slower due to business. Still highly recommended!

data.title: A Bit of The Old Country
data.text: Great food and a wonderful atmosphere.  Our server was outstanding.  Cheesesteak and fries, burger and lamb burger.  All were really good.  The wine and the Guinness were all good as well.  Worth the stop if you are in Reading.

data.title: Friendly service.
data.text: Some of the best service we've had in a while. Great waitress (Rachel), neat atmosphere, really good soup and seafood. Also great beer selection, as the waitress guided us through all the microbrews.

data.title: Great food and beer
data.text: I have gone to this place for years. It is privately owned by a hands on owner, Glen. All the food is great. I love the soups, oysters, and burgers, but it is all great. The beer selection is also nice, with rotating taps, as well as lots of bottles. Nice decor and parking is easy. This place has a real personality.

data.title: Interesting atmosphere, great drink selection, with some improvements needed
data.text: The property itself is really unique with loads of charming features. It could be cleaner. The menu has some standouts, I've ordered the prime rib several times and its always great! I LOVE the oysters they really get them fresh and tasty and have more variety than most places in Berks. The bar also carries a lot of variety so you'll do well here. The main issue i find is the staff. they all been there for many years and seem to eat as much food as they serve as i always see staff eating behind the bar except when owner is there. The staff came come off as being rude. this is commonly known. I guess its part of the culture of the restaurant however as you do get used to it and maybe even appreciate it.

data.title: A bit of Ireland/Scotland in Reading
data.text: Have been there several times, the selection of beers is typical of an Irish pub house. Usually order some sort of seafood and I not been disappointed. The steamed seafood sampler, listed as an appetizer serves as a meal and the shrimp bisque is always good. When I have guests in from out of town the Ugly Oyster is a go to on my list.

data.title: Institution
data.text:
We have been coming here for years and seen the neighborhood change from good to bad to good and bad again but this place stayed consistent and good. The service is friendly and the food is good and plentiful. Huge portions for the price. Our faves are their salads and soups bit everything else is good too. Parking is across in a paid parking open space. 

Highly recommend this place for your casual and fun meal out

data.title: What happened to this place??
data.text:
I pride myself on giving fair reviews and it disappoints me to have to give this place 2 stars. I have been to this restaurant probably 6-8 times or so over the last several years. (I live 40 mins away so it's not close to home.) It's my kind of place, I like pubs with good food and a good craft beer selection. 

My husband and I went last week for our 11 year wedding anniversary dinner and it was a flop. We both ended up ordering the prime rib, something I rarely get but was in the mood for. It was served with a salad. We got about 1/2 way through the salad and our prime rib was brought out. A little annoying, we were cooped up in a corner on this tiny table that shelved every sauce imaginable ... I had no idea where she was going to set the food down. Not the end of the world ... but then we started eating our prime rib and it was cold. The fries they were served with were also cold. Our meals were $25 a piece, for that price I'm not letting it slide. 

So we waited there at our table for 5 mins, meanwhile our waitress was yackin' it up with the bartender and the other staff, scrolling on her phone about 10 feet away. I didn't have all night, so I had to get up and ask her to come back to the table. She did tell the owner (who we learned had been standing right next to her while she updated her Facebook status), and they both scrambled to fix the problem. I do give the owner credit though, he was very nice and did apologize several times. They heated up our food and said they gave us fresh fries. We're reasonable people, so we accepted that they tried to make it right. I still didn't really care for the waitress, I felt like she should be working at a diner instead of a nice restaurant. 

So the icing on the cake was heating up our leftovers the next day. We each had at least 1/2 of our prime rib left. Sat down at the table only to realize that our pieces were ALL FAT. There were maybe 3 or 4 bites of meat, but that was it. I know prime rib is not a lean meat, but I'm not exaggerating when I say the entire thing was fat. We couldn't believe it, but agreed that they should have noticed at some point how fatty these pieces were at least before they cooked it. So there's apparently no quality control ... 

It will be a long time before we go back, if at all.

data.title: Prime Rib was disppointing
data.text: We usually try to stop in 1 or 2 times a year for the prime rib. Our last visit was about a year ago and will probably not come back. The prime rib was extremely tough and the drinks were very expensive. We'll look elsewhere as there are too many choices that wouldn't require a trip into Reading..

data.title: Best steak in tiwn
data.text: They advertise that they have the best steak in town and they were right! But it is a bar and mitre ally for a family. They did have two small tables at the front we were able to sit in with the kids.

data.title: Average restaurant
data.text: First visit in this place and I feel like disappointed. Nice place, friendly service and I had not to wait to be served but the platter crab is not at the level of what a good crab is. If I go back there (and I think I will do because they try their best ), I will go for steak or hamburger. Hope with better experience !

data.title: I Wish We Had an Ugly Oyster in Connecticut!!!
data.text:
We were in Reading for one night and I could tell from the reviews we would love this place, and we did. Truly amazing and creative seafood, well-made martinis, fun and friendly staff, and a terrific casual atmosphere.

We had a great time talking to the owner and the bartenders. We loved our meal: Blue Point oysters (better than the ones we get in CT, and that's where the oysters are from!), curry scallop chowder, crabcakes, and the seafood combo platter. Everything was sensational, and we were amazed how small the bill was. 

I had to get a souvenir glass to take home - and a photo of the "ugly oysters" mural outside - so we will remember this place forever.

data.title: Gem within Reading
data.text: My husband and I were looking for some place different for lunch. It had been many years since we had been to the Ugly Oyster or most any restaurant in Reading. We were not disappointed. The staff was friend and the food was terrific. The tootsie pop with the check was a nice treat. We will definitely be back.

data.title: True Pub Atmosphere and Food
data.text: Like a real pub, the furniture doesn't match, the lighting is dark, and the beer is served cold. Our server was great -- really down to earth and funny. He provided us with good recommendations on dishes to try for our particular tastes. My husband had the Fish & Chips, Old School style and I tried a Scallops special. Both were phenomenal. Reservations are a good idea.

data.title: Seafood at its finest!
data.text: The seafood is great, especially the crab cake.  Just enough filler to hold it together.  Try the Malibu Grill for a sandwich.

data.title: A Real Irish Pub in Reading, PA
data.text: Very cool old pub atmosphere, beautiful bar, nice booths. I guess I don't need to go to Ireland for a Guinness because the real thing is here. Another spot in Reading, PA to not miss. Great for taking friends from out of town.
